properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 9 at 8:20AM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Warning
for the following rivers in Mississippi...

Pearl River At Edinburg affecting Leake County
Pearl River Near Carthage affecting Leake County
Yockanookany River Near Kosciusko affecting Attala County
Yockanookany River Near Ofahoma affecting Leake County


SYNOPSIS...

Heavy rainfall event is moving into the region beginning Monday
and going through Thursday.  These crests are based on 48 hours
of rainfall. Since this is only the first 2 days of the rainfall,
crest could go higer based on additional heavy rainfal beyond
48 hours.

The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Pearl River Near Carthage
* from late Monday night until further notice.
* At  7:45 AM Sunday the stage was 15.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 17.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will remain steady today but should
begin rising on Monday morning. The River will rise above
flood stage Tuesday morning and will continue to rise to
near 21.0 feet Saturday morning.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet...Widespread flooding of lowlands upstream and
downstream of the State Highway 35 bridge is occurring.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 48 hours.

Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected tonight between 8 and
10 PM.
